intro: Ageratina campyloclada, commonly known as the narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are blue to purple in color and are arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Ageratina campyloclada is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for certain insects.
